Welcome to PATHFIT3! At PATHFIT3, we believe that dance is not just a series of movements; it’s a dynamic form of expression that enriches lives. Our goal is to make dance education accessible to everyone, regardless of experience. Through our innovative Android app, we’re dedicated to helping you explore and master the art of dance. Whether youre a Student or a PE Teacher looking to enhance your learning and dance skills, PATHFIT3 is designed to support you at every stage of your dance journey. Our app features:\n • Comprehensive Dance Curriculum: \nOur carefully curated curriculum covers a variety of dance styles, from ballet and hip-hop to contemporary and cheer dance. Each section includes detailed lessons that break down techniques and movements, allowing you to learn progressively.\n • Structured Learning Paths: \nWe offer tailored learning paths that guide you through each dance style, ensuring you build a solid foundation before moving on to more advanced techniques. This structured approach helps you develop confidence and skill over time.\n • Interactive Tutorials: \nEngage with our step-by-step video tutorials that provide clear demonstrations and helpful tips for mastering each dance move. You’ll be able to practice at your own pace, with the ability to revisit lessons as needed.\n At PATHFIT3, we’re passionate about fostering a love for dance while promoting fitness and well-being. We invite you to download the PATHFIT3 app today and embark on a rewarding journey of Pathfit 3 dance education!

In Pre-Historic era, dance reflected in wall paintings, reliefs, and in the literary record in hieroglyphs? On which dance period, dance was used as a medium of religious expression? In Ancient Rome era, dance was considered as a form of entertainment and display? Dances became part of worships and church services during Ancient Egypt era? On which dance period, the Christian Fathers approved the use of dance, provided that its form and intent were holy and profound? The beginning of Social Dancing was happened on which dance period? In the Renaissance era, dance was wholly accepted in the courts in Europe? In Couple dance, dancers hold each other by hand, forming a long chain and move about in an open closed circle? Round dance was not popular than Couple dance as it was considered scandalous when first seen? In Ancient Greek era, dance was an aid to military education? On which dance period, people performed dance in village squares to welcome feudal lords in the castles? More court dances performed by nobility came about as well as rise of art in ballet in Italy and France? On which dance period, common people amused themselves by doing dances that were social in character? Did Dance and art in general gain Impetus? There are five (5) dance steps of peasants? Dancing is one of the oldest and most popular forms of exercise? Dance has evolved to modern forms of social dancing? There are three (3) types of dancing performed by peasants? During the Ancient Egypt era, dance was a major form of religious, ritual, and social expression with primitive cultures? During the Ancient Rome era, people stopped valuing such qualities in art as the nation grew wealthy and powerful?

Dance in this period are a major form of religious, ritual, and social expression with primitive culture? Dance in this period are reflected in wall paintings, reliefs, and in the literary record in hieroglyphs? Dance in this period are a form of entertainment and display? Dance in this period became part of worships and church services? In this period, people stopped valuing such qualities in art as the nation grew wealthy and powerful? In this period, people performed dance in village squares to welcome feudal lords in the castles? In this period, the common people amused themselves by doing dances that were social in character? In this period, dance was wholly accepted in the courts as a gradual increase of the capitalist class produced patrons of learning and art in Europe. In this period, more court dances performed by nobility came about as well as rise of art in ballet in Italy and France? In this period, several other dance forms continued to sprout and spread across several countries?

Contemporary dance is the style of dancing where dancers are free to express their feelings through movements? Folk dances may be religious or secular in nature? Ballroom is widely enjoyed on stage, film, and television because of its performance and entertainment aspects? This type of dance are unique to certain localities only? Folk dances are usually done in honor of a patron saint or as a thanksgiving for a bountiful harvest? Traditional dance are cultural dances performed to the strong beats of percussion instruments by a community of people sharing the same culture? Ballet is an artistic, programmatic, scenic dance accompanied by music?

Dance Periods What is Dance Pre-Historic Ancient Egypt Ancient Greek Ancient Rome Catholic Church In Europe Dark And Early Middle Ages Early Renaissance Europe in 15th and 16th Century Benefit Of Dance
Nature Of Dance
Is the movement of the body in a rhythmic way, usually to music and within given space, for the purpose of expressing and idea or emotion , releasing energy, or simply taking delight in movement. \n \nIs an expresssion of the body, following rhythmic patterns and is accompanied by music. From Primitive man expressing emotions ins such events such as birth, death marriage, war, among other things, dance has evolved to modern forms of social gatherings. \n \n is one of the oldest and most popular forms of exercise.
A major form of religious ritual and social expression with primitive cultures. A way of expressing and tribal unity and strength.\n \n An approach for courtship and mating \n \n A means of worship communication and therapeutic experience.
Become a fullblown and was richly recorded. It is also reflected in wall paintings, reliefs and in literary record in hieroglyphs. \n \n As a medium of religious expression.
Is an to military education, And as a form of entertainment display
In the Roman era They stopped valuing such qualities in arts as the nations grew wealthy and powerful. The romans ceased to create and perform within the arts themselves.
The Christian Fathers approved the used of dance, provided that its form and intent were holy and profound. As dances then became part of worships and church activities
They performed dance in the village squares to welcome the feudal lords in the castles. \n \n The common people amused themselves by doing dances that were social in character. it is also the beginning of Social Dancing.\n \n Two types of dance performed by peasants. \n \n Round dance: dancers hold each other by hand forming a long chain and move about in an open closed circle. \n \n Couple Dance: It was not as popular than round dance as it was considered scandalous when first seen.
Was wholly accepted in courts as a gradual increases of the capitalist class produced patrons of learning and arts in Europe. \n\n Dance and art in general gains impetus \n\n The entertainers now become valuable appendage to the courts of Italy and France.
More court dances performed by nobility came about as well as rise of art in ballet in Italy and France. \n\n Several other dance forms continued to sprout and spread across several countries.
Hello blank fragment
Physical Develop cardiovascular endurance\n Improves coordination, balance, flexibility and body composition.\n Lower risk cardiovascular disease.\n Lower body mass index.\n Lower resting heart.\n Improves lipid metabolism.\n Enable joint mobility.\n Helps improve and maintain bone density.
Mental/Emotional Help keep the brain sharp.\n Decrease incidence of Dementia and Alzheimers Disease.\n Decrease depressive symptoms.\n Increase self-esteem and improves body image.\n Aids in releasing emotional and physical tension.
Social Give sense of togetherness within group.\n Encourages positive social interaction and interpersonal relationship in group.\n Contributes to the individuals for self-actualization in society.\n
Cultural Promotes cultural values.
Traditional Dances(Folk and Ethnic). Are dances indigenous communities that show cultural traits of people i specific time and place.\n Customs and traditions through dance steps and costumes are preserved in traditional dance.
Three Types of Social Dances. Ritual Dance.\n
Life Cycle Dance.\n
Occupational Dance.\n Occupational dance is a form of art that expresses the hardworking value of Filipinos. from different places in the country by showing their local culture and livelihood. The. theme of the folk dance would differ depending on where they live - near the seas, in. the fields, by the mountains, etc.
Folk Dance According to geographical locations, Folk Dances can be:/n National Dances with common basic movements, with slight variations.\n\n Local/Regional\n Dances that are unique to certain localities only.
Modern And Contemporary Dance Modern Dance: is the style of dancing where dancers are free to express their feelings through movements.\n\n Contemporary Dance:\n incorporate the strong legwork and balance off ballet and trunk movements of modern dance.
CheerDance A combination of cheering and dancing.\n\n Components include the mandatory cheer as well aas number of gymnastics and acrobatic moves such as cartwheels and hand springs
StreetDance HipHop:\n is a dance style performed to hip-hop music and usually dance in the street.\n it includes a wide range of styles primarily breaking, locking and popping.
Ballet It was taken from the Italian word "BALLARE" meaning TO DANCE, and "BALLO" referring to DANCES PERFORMED IN BALLROOMS.\n combinations of arts of dancing poetry, music, painting.\n An artistic, programmatic, scenic dance accompanied by music.
Ballroom Is a set of partner dances, which are enjoyed both socially and competitively around the world.\n because of its performance and entertainment aspects, ballroom dance is also widely enjoyed on stage, film and televisions.
Festival Dance Are cultural dances performed to the strong beats of percussion instruments by a community of people sharing the same culture usually done in honor of a patron saint or as a thanksgiving for a bountiful harvest.\n Festival Dances may be religious or secular in nature.
